question: Which of the following is the ultimate defender/guarantor of Fundamental Rights in India?
explanation: Article 32 makes the Supreme Court the ultimate defender/guarantor of Fundamental Rights. Whenever, rights of individuals stand breached that can seek redress from the Supreme Court. It has been given the supreme authority by the Constitution of India to enforce the Fundamental Rights and the Supreme Court can issue writs or any order/directives to enforce the enjoyment of Fundamental Rights.
